channel.description: Recent content in Fundamentals on Analyst

item.title: Ios Keychain
item.description: In this article I’m trying to study how keychain works. Metaphor There once lived a monkey üêí George.

item.title: Mach O File
item.description: Intro Using otool we can get general info about the Mach-O file: otool -h [app_name] > Mach header magic cputype cpusubtype caps filetype ncmds sizeofcmds flags 0xfeedfacf 16777228 0 0x00 2 115 11384 0x00218085 Quick refernce on the meaning:

item.title: Ios Booting Process
item.description: When an iDevice is started, two separate booting processes are taking place: booting of Application Processor and booting of Secure Enclave.

item.title: Jailbreaking
item.description: Types of jailbreaking Tethered jailbreaks don’t persist through reboots, so re-applying jailbreaks requires the device to be connected (tethered) to a computer during every reboot.

item.title: Intro
item.description: UID - key that is fused into Application processor. No one know it and can get from the device.

item.title: Ipa Structure
item.description: When installed on the device, *.ipa is unzipped into a corresponding folder. That’s the contents:

item.title: Apple Devices Encryption
item.description: Intro All this resembles the sad story of a businessman from Eine Woche volle Samstage (1973) by Paul Maar, when a man was so afraid of thieves that he hid the office key in a sock, the sock - in a boot, the boot in a wardrobe locked with a key, the key to the wardrobe hid in his table’s drawer, and the key from the last had lost and by doing so arranged an unscheduled day-off for his employees.

item.title: Encryption
item.description: The main idea behind the scenes is that applications or even OS itself doesn’t know the keys.
